intro: Pentas tibestica, commonly known as the Tibesti pentas, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Tibesti Mountains in Chad. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and produces clusters of vibrant, star-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are adapted to minimize water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a hardy species suited to semi-desert conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
